FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Quality and Regulatory Affairs (QRA) representatives.  

The Linweld facility at Oakland NE is an Acetylene manufacturer.  At this facility we produce, pump and transport Acetylene to our other retail sites.  This process is accomplished through the use of an acetylene generator in which Calcium Carbide is mixed with water to produce acetylene gas which is then purified, dried and pumped to various size cylinders.  These cylinders are shipped to our other retail locations for resale.  The slurry that is produced by this process is pumped to a slurry pond where the water is allowed to naturally evaporate.   When the resulting calcium is dried it is removed and disposed of.   

Presently the total quantity of pure acetylene that is handled and stored on this site is approximately 37,920 pounds.  Acetylene is pumped from the generator to the compressors at 8 p.s.i..  From the compressors the acetylene is pumped to the cylinders at between 200 and 300 p.s.i..   All of the cylinders contain a specific amount of acetone depending on the size of the cylinder being filled.  The acetone and acetylene chemically bond so that the acetylene is suspended in a stable condition for transport and use.  This creates a Flammable Chemical Mixture in that by EPA definition, the regulated substance present in a mixture and the concentration of the substance is above one percent by weight of the mixture.  The total amount of pure acetone present at the facility can reach 38,666 pounds in storage and in the cylinders. Because of the number of different size cylinders this facility can fill, the measurements taken were based on maximum potential size of the cylinders being that can be filled at the same time.

LINWELD is committed to a safety and health management system based on a common understanding of risks and how to control them.  It recognizes that safety and health are management responsibilities of equal importance to our production work and that effective control of safety and health is achieved through cooperative effort at all levels within our organization.  We devote sufficient effort and resources to the organization of and arrangements for safety and health of our employees and those who may be affected by our work.

LINWELD complies with all statutory obligations including the provision of adequate supervision, information, education and training; so that all staff recognizes their responsibilities.  Among other things we strive to maintain all of our workplaces in a safe and healthy condition as per statutory requirements and best business practices; free of harassment or unnecessary mental or emotional stressors;  provide all necessary information, instruction, supervision and training to our employees, supervisors and managers; operate and maintain all buildings, plants, machinery, equipment and work processes, safely without any known risks to the health and safety to our employees or the out-lying community.  Additionally, all contractors and sub-contractors that work on, with or around our staff or facilities are trained and experienced in safety and health policies that are equal to our policies. We perform these duties, so far as is reasonably practical, taking into account published guidance, of other governmental agencies including OSHA 1910.38: OSHA's Emergency Action Plan; RCRA (40 CFR 264, 265, 279.52); State EPCRA Rules/Law; NFPA 58 and Nebraska state law based on NFPA 58; ANSI Standards; ASME Standards; Compressed Gas Association as well as other agencies.
